albums.title: Pablo Honey
albums.description: Released in 1993, Radiohead's debut album includes the breakout hit 'Creep'. Though initially met with mixed reviews, it later gained recognition as the start of a groundbreaking career.

albums.title: The Bends
albums.description: Released in 1995, 'The Bends' marked Radiohead's shift toward a more layered and emotional sound, with tracks like 'Fake Plastic Trees' and 'Street Spirit (Fade Out)'.

albums.title: OK Computer
albums.description: Released in 1997, 'OK Computer' is often hailed as one of the greatest albums of all time. It explored themes of technology and isolation, and its success transformed the band into global icons.

albums.title: Kid A
albums.description: In 2000, Radiohead released 'Kid A', a radical departure from rock into experimental electronica. It initially divided fans but is now considered a modern masterpiece.

albums.title: In Rainbows
albums.description: In 2007, 'In Rainbows' was released with a revolutionary 'pay what you want' model. Musically warm and emotionally direct, it includes fan favorites like 'Nude' and 'Weird Fishes'.

albums.title: Voltes i voltes
albums.description: Released in 2022, this sophomore album expands Maria Jaume’s sound with light percussion, synth layers and fuller arrangements. The title reflects cycles of thought and travel, capturing her introspective perspective shaped by life between Mallorca and Barcelona.

albums.title: Nostàlgia Airlines SOUVENIR
albums.description: Released in 2025, 'Nostàlgia Airlines SOUVENIR' dives into retro pop textures and dreamy melancholy. With playful arrangements and surreal lyrical imagery, it marks a stylistic evolution while staying rooted in Maria Jaume’s poetic voice.

albums.title: Antònia Font
albums.description: Released in 1999, their self-titled debut introduced the band’s playful, science-fiction-tinged Catalan lyrics and Mediterranean pop melodies. It laid the groundwork for their cult following in the Balearic music scene.

albums.title: A Rússia
albums.description: Released in 2001, 'A Rússia' expanded their sonic palette with rich instrumentation and surreal imagery, further establishing their identity as creative outliers in Catalan pop.

albums.title: Alegria
albums.description: Released in 2002, 'Alegria' became one of the band’s most iconic records. It includes fan favorites like 'Wa Yeah!' and reflects their perfect balance of optimism and oddity.

albums.title: Batiscafo Katiuscas
albums.description: Released in 2006, this album is a fan favorite for its underwater metaphors and dreamy production. The title track and 'Armando Rampas' showcase their lyrical surrealism at its peak.

albums.title: Lamparetes
albums.description: Released in 2011 after a brief hiatus, 'Lamparetes' features a matured sound and poetic lyrics, including the standout single 'Clint Eastwood'. It became their last album before an eight-year break.

albums.title: Un minut estroboscòpica
albums.description: Released in 2022, this comeback album marked Antònia Font’s return after nearly a decade apart. It reflects a more reflective, polished tone while retaining their unique linguistic and melodic style.

albums.title: Stranger in the Alps
albums.description: Phoebe Bridgers' debut solo album, known for its haunting lyrics and intimate acoustic sound.

albums.title: Punisher
albums.description: Her critically acclaimed second album that blends indie rock and folk with deeply personal storytelling.

albums.title: Immunity
albums.description: Clairo's debut studio album featuring a blend of lo-fi pop and indie electronic sounds, praised for its candid lyricism.

albums.title: Sling
albums.description: Her sophomore album, showcasing a more mature sound with elements of folk and soft rock, reflecting personal growth.

albums.title: Charm
albums.description: Clairo's third album that continues to explore introspective themes with a dreamy, synth-pop vibe.

albums.title: Rock Transgresivo
albums.description: Extremoduro's debut album, laying the foundation of their rebellious and raw rock style.

albums.title: Yo, Minoría Absoluta
albums.description: An album reflecting a darker, more introspective phase in the band's career.

albums.title: La Ley Innata
albums.description: A concept album that explores existential themes with complex compositions and intense lyrics.

albums.title: Material Defectuoso
albums.description: Their last studio album, showcasing maturity and a refined rock sound.

albums.title: 10 milles per veure una bona armadura
albums.description: An album blending indie pop and folk with introspective and heartfelt lyrics.

albums.title: Atletes, baixin de l'escenari
albums.description: Exploring new sounds with a mix of electronic and pop influences.

albums.title: Els millors professors europeus
albums.description: An album by Manel featuring their signature Catalan indie-folk sound with thoughtful lyrics and melodic arrangements.

albums.title: Arrival
albums.description: Featuring timeless hits like 'Dancing Queen', this album marked their global peak.

albums.title: Voulez-Vous
albums.description: A disco-influenced album with danceable tracks and polished production.

albums.title: Super Trouper
albums.description: Includes hits like 'The Winner Takes It All', blending emotional lyrics with catchy melodies.

albums.title: The Balcony
albums.description: Debut album that brought their energetic indie rock sound to a wider audience.

albums.title: The Ride
albums.description: Follow-up album featuring more polished production and catchy rock anthems.

albums.title: The Balance
albums.description: Their third album, continuing to develop their sound with emotional and energetic tracks.

albums.title: Frank
albums.description: Debut album blending jazz, soul, and R&B influences, showcasing Amy's unique vocal style.

albums.title: Back to Black
albums.description: Critically acclaimed sophomore album featuring hits like 'Rehab' and 'Back to Black'.

albums.title: Blurryface
albums.description: Concept album exploring themes of anxiety and insecurity, featuring hits like 'Stressed Out'.

albums.title: Trench
albums.description: A darker, more complex album continuing the story of their fictional world.

albums.title: Clancy
albums.description: An EP expanding the narrative universe of Twenty One Pilots.
